description: Updates a launch of a given feature. Don't use this operation to update the tags of an existing launch. Instead, use TagResource.

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: An array of structures that contains the feature and variations that are to be used for the launch. (dict) --- A structure that defines one launch group in a launch. A launch group is a variation of the feature that you are including in the launch. description (string) --- A description of the launch group. The feature that this launch is using. A name for this launch group. The feature variation to use for this launch group.

nested_params.name: description
nested_params.description: A description of the launch group.

nested_params.name: feature
nested_params.description: The feature that this launch is using.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: A name for this launch group.

nested_params.name: variation
nested_params.description: The feature variation to use for this launch group.

parameters.name: launch
parameters.description: The name of the launch that is to be updated.

parameters.name: metricMonitors
parameters.description: An array of structures that define the metrics that will be used to monitor the launch performance. (dict) --- A structure that defines a metric to be used to monitor performance of the variations during a launch. A structure that defines the metric. The entity, such as a user or session, that does an action that causes a metric value to be recorded. An example is userDetails.userID. eventPattern (string) --- The EventBridge event pattern that defines how the metric is recorded. For more information about EventBridge event patterns, see Amazon EventBridge event patterns. A name for the metric. unitLabel (string) --- A label for the units that the metric is measuring. The value that is tracked to produce the metric.

nested_params.name: metricDefinition
nested_params.description: A structure that defines the metric.

nested_params.name: entityIdKey
nested_params.description: The entity, such as a user or session, that does an action that causes a metric value to be recorded. An example is userDetails.userID.

nested_params.name: eventPattern
nested_params.description: The EventBridge event pattern that defines how the metric is recorded. For more information about EventBridge event patterns, see Amazon EventBridge event patterns.

nested_params.name: unitLabel
nested_params.description: A label for the units that the metric is measuring.

nested_params.name: valueKey
nested_params.description: The value that is tracked to produce the metric.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the project that contains the launch that you want to update.

parameters.name: scheduledSplitsConfig
parameters.description: An array of structures that define the traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during each step of the launch. This also defines the start time of each step. (dict) --- This structure defines the traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during one step of a launch, and the start time of that step. The traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during one step of a launch. This is a set of key-value pairs. The keys are variation names. The values represent the percentage of traffic to allocate to that variation during this step. The values is expressed in thousandths of a percent, so assigning a weight of 50000 assigns 50% of traffic to that variation. If the sum of the weights for all the variations in a segment override does not add up to 100,000, then the remaining traffic that matches this segment is not assigned by this segment override, and instead moves on to the next segment override or the default traffic split. (string) --- (integer) --- segmentOverrides (list) --- Use this parameter to specify different traffic splits for one or more audience segments. A segment is a portion of your audience that share one or more characteristics. Examples could be Chrome browser users, users in Europe, or Firefox browser users in Europe who also fit other criteria that your application collects, such as age. This parameter is an array of up to six segment override objects. Each of these objects specifies a segment that you have already created, and defines the traffic split for that segment. (dict) --- This structure specifies a segment that you have already created, and defines the traffic split for that segment to be used in a launch. A number indicating the order to use to evaluate segment overrides, if there are more than one. Segment overrides with lower numbers are evaluated first. The ARN of the segment to use. The traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations to assign to this segment. The values represent the amount of traffic to allocate to that variation for this segment. This is expressed in thousandths of a percent, so a weight of 50000 represents 50% of traffic. (string) --- (integer) --- The date and time that this step of the launch starts.

nested_params.name: steps
nested_params.description: An array of structures that define the traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during each step of the launch. This also defines the start time of each step.

nested_params.name: groupWeights
nested_params.description: The traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during one step of a launch. This is a set of key-value pairs. The keys are variation names. The values represent the percentage of traffic to allocate to that variation during this step. The values is expressed in thousandths of a percent, so assigning a weight of 50000 assigns 50% of traffic to that variation. If the sum of the weights for all the variations in a segment override does not add up to 100,000, then the remaining traffic that matches this segment is not assigned by this segment override, and instead moves on to the next segment override or the default traffic split.

nested_params.name: segmentOverrides
nested_params.description: Use this parameter to specify different traffic splits for one or more audience segments. A segment is a portion of your audience that share one or more characteristics. Examples could be Chrome browser users, users in Europe, or Firefox browser users in Europe who also fit other criteria that your application collects, such as age. This parameter is an array of up to six segment override objects. Each of these objects specifies a segment that you have already created, and defines the traffic split for that segment.

nested_params.name: evaluationOrder
nested_params.description: A number indicating the order to use to evaluate segment overrides, if there are more than one. Segment overrides with lower numbers are evaluated first.

nested_params.name: segment
nested_params.description: The ARN of the segment to use.

nested_params.name: weights
nested_params.description: The traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations to assign to this segment. This is a set of key-value pairs. The keys are variation names. The values represent the amount of traffic to allocate to that variation for this segment. This is expressed in thousandths of a percent, so a weight of 50000 represents 50% of traffic.

nested_params.name: startTime
nested_params.description: The date and time that this step of the launch starts.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the launch.

nested_items.name: createdTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the launch is created.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the launch.

nested_items.name: execution
nested_items.description: A structure that contains information about the start and end times of the launch.

nested_items.name: endedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the launch ended.

nested_items.name: startedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the launch started.

nested_items.name: groups
nested_items.description: An array of structures that define the feature variations that are being used in the launch.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the launch group.

nested_items.name: featureVariations
nested_items.description: The feature variation for this launch group. This is a key-value pair.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the launch group.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the launch was most recently updated.

nested_items.name: metricMonitors
nested_items.description: An array of structures that define the metrics that are being used to monitor the launch performance.

nested_items.name: metricDefinition
nested_items.description: A structure that defines the metric.

nested_items.name: entityIdKey
nested_items.description: The entity, such as a user or session, that does an action that causes a metric value to be recorded.

nested_items.name: eventPattern
nested_items.description: The EventBridge event pattern that defines how the metric is recorded.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: unitLabel
nested_items.description: The label for the units that the metric is measuring.

nested_items.name: valueKey
nested_items.description: The value that is tracked to produce the metric.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the launch.

nested_items.name: project
nested_items.description: The name or ARN of the project that contains the launch.

nested_items.name: randomizationSalt
nested_items.description: This value is used when Evidently assigns a particular user session to the launch, to help create a randomization ID to determine which variation the user session is served. This randomization ID is a combination of the entity ID and randomizationSalt.

nested_items.name: scheduledSplitsDefinition
nested_items.description: An array of structures that define the traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during each step of the launch.

nested_items.description: An array of structures that define the traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during each step of the launch. This also defines the start time of each step.

nested_items.name: groupWeights
nested_items.description: The traffic allocation percentages among the feature variations during one step of a launch. This is a set of key-value pairs. The keys are variation names. The values represent the percentage of traffic to allocate to that variation during this step.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: Use this parameter to specify different traffic splits for one or more audience segments. A segment is a portion of your audience that share one or more characteristics. Examples could be Chrome browser users, users in Europe, or Firefox browser users in Europe who also fit other criteria that your application collects, such as age.

nested_items.name: evaluationOrder
nested_items.description: A number indicating the order to use to evaluate segment overrides, if there are more than one. Segment overrides with lower numbers are evaluated first.

nested_items.name: segment

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current state of the launch.

nested_items.name: statusReason
nested_items.description: If the launch was stopped, this is the string that was entered by the person who stopped the launch, to explain why it was stopped.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of launch.
